title: What are some of the most educational iPad apps for kids? - Quora

response.answer_text: This answer is constantly changing and greatly depends on your kids (their ages, educational backgrounds, learning preferences, etc). Any apps I tell you about today may likely be usurped by other apps next week. So instead, I'll tell you about a service that works like a Consumer Reports for educational apps: Balefire Labs. It is a subscription-based service, so I can't provide a complete list of their top apps right now, since they don't provide one for free. But here is a list of apps that have received their "TopRated Badge." Note: links open to edshelf, which includes links to the apps and a link to the respective Balefire Labs report. the Little Blue Dragon App. it is an augmented reality book. Very interesting for kids. The book tells the story of a mystical creature saving its home and meeting new friends along the way, who are animals that are either extinct or on the verge of extinction. The book is also supplemented with coloring pages available for printing. After done coloring, use the app to watch the characters on those pages come to life. The Little Blue dragon App has a lot of options to offer. One of them - helps kids follow up on the daily hygiene routine. Kids are also offered to enter magical world through a special portal or have a pet-friend by one's side at any desirable moment. The main character of the book - The Little BLue Dragon can appear in the room or any other place . It's like magic! And the app is free for downloading. All I can say is that my daughter really likes it!
